JUNK.Definition: things of no value or use

TAKE IT AWAY.Definition: transfer it to a different location

ON THE OTHER HAND.Definition: from a different or opposite point of view, on the contrary

CORRELATED.Definition: having the same relationship or connection to each other

CAVEMAN.Definition: a prehistoric man who lived in caves

DISPOSAL.Definition: the act of throwing something of no use away

DISPOSING.Definition: throwing something of no use away

PITS.Definition: large holes dug in the ground

DISPOSE.Definition: throw it away, get rid of

PILES.Definition: quantities put on top of each other

AMPHORAE.Definition: containers used to hold olive oil in Roman times

CLAY.Definition: dried earth used for making bricks and pottery

HIDDEN.Definition: not easy to see or find

FERTILISER.Definition: substances added to earth to make plants grow well

CROPS.Definition: plants grown by people in large amounts

LAW-ABIDING.Definition: behaving according to the laws, obedient and lawful

LANDFILL.Definition: an area where rubbish or waste is put in the ground

LANDFILLS.Definition: areas where rubbish or waste is put in the ground

INCINERATOR.Definition: a device for burning things that are of no use

METHANE.Definition: a type of gas with no smell or colour

ENVIRONMENTALLY CONSCIOUS.Definition: showing that he cares about the environment

STRAWS.Definition: thin hollow tubes for drinking from a glass or bottle

TAP.Definition: a device by which water from a pipe can be controlled, a faucet

TINNED.Definition: kept or preserved in a metal container or can

MAKE FROM SCRATCH.Definition: make from the beginning, without using anything that already existed

CLOTH.Definition: woven material or fabric made from wool, cotton etc.

AMMUNITION.Definition: objects that can be shot from a weapon, bullets

THROWAWAY.Definition: relating to the practice of throwing away a product after using it only for a short time

SINGLE-USE.Definition: intended or planned to be used once and then thrown away

PLANT.Definition: a place where industrial process takes place

EXCEPTION.Definition: something that does not behave in the same way as others

WASHED INTO.Definition: driven or led by water into

UNUSABLE.Definition: of no use, not able to be used

DOING OUR BIT.Definition: doing what we can to help or contribute

BOB AROUND.Definition: moving up and down with no specific destination

CARDBOARD.Definition: thick brown paper usually used for making boxes

DELICATE.Definition: fine, needing careful attention to keep or maintain
